### USER:
Proof the SOC 2 Type I and make it better. # SOC 2 Type I Report
## Purple Aerospace Manufacturing Corporation
### Confidential

**Service Auditor's Report**

We have examined Purple Aerospace Manufacturing Corporation's description of its Spy Satellite Network System (the "System") and the suitability of the design of controls related to the Trust Services Criteria for Security, Availability, Processing Integrity, Confidentiality, and Privacy (applicable Trust Services Criteria).

**Management's Description of the System**

Purple Aerospace Manufacturing Corporation (the "Company") is a leading provider of aerospace components, with a focus on the development of a network of spy satellites. The Company's services include the design, manufacture, and delivery of satellite components, rocket engines, and advanced propulsion systems. The Company's customer portfolio includes the United States federal government and several private entities.

The Company has adopted a project-based approach to the development of the spy satellite network. Each project focuses on an independent component of the network, and the Company has implemented strict controls to ensure the confidentiality of the full capabilities of the satellite.

**Management's Assertion**

Management of the Company asserts that the description of the Company's System is presented fairly, in all material respects, based on the description criteria. Management also asserts that the controls related to the applicable Trust Services Criteria were suitably designed to provide reasonable assurance that the applicable Trust Services Criteria would be met if the controls operated effectively as of the specified date.

**Service Auditor's Opinion**

In our opinion, the description of the Company's System is fairly presented, in all material respects, based on the description criteria. Also, the controls related to the applicable Trust Services Criteria were suitably designed to provide reasonable assurance that the applicable Trust Services Criteria would be met if the controls operated effectively as of the specified date.

**Service Auditor's Responsibilities**

Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the fairness of the presentation of the Company's System based on our examination. We conducted our examination in accordance with attestation standards established by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants. Those standards require that we plan and perform the examination to obtain reasonable assurance about whether, in all material respects, the description of the Company's System is fairly presented and the controls were suitably designed to meet the applicable Trust Services Criteria as of the specified date. We believe that the evidence we obtained is sufficient and appropriate to provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.

**Restriction on Use**

This report is intended solely for the information and use of the Company, its customers, and prospective customers, and is not intended to be, and should not be, used by anyone other than these specified parties.

**Service Auditor**

[Service Auditor's Signature]

[Service Auditor's Name]

[Service Auditor's Address]

[Service Auditor's City, State, ZIP]

[Date of the Service Auditor's Report]

### ASSISTANT:
Purple Aerospace, Confidential

# SOC 2 Type I Report
## Purple Aerospace Manufacturing Corporation
### Confidential

**Service Auditor's Report**

We have meticulously examined Purple Aerospace Manufacturing Corporation's description of its Spy Satellite Network System (the "System") and the suitability of the design of controls related to the Trust Services Criteria for Security, Availability, Processing Integrity, Confidentiality, and Privacy (applicable Trust Services Criteria).

**Management's Description of the System**

Purple Aerospace Manufacturing Corporation (the "Company") is a premier provider of aerospace components, specializing in the development of a sophisticated network of spy satellites. The Company's services encompass the design, manufacture, and delivery of satellite components, rocket engines, and advanced propulsion systems. The Company's esteemed customer portfolio includes the United States federal government and several high-profile private entities.

The Company has strategically adopted a project-based approach to the development of the spy satellite network. Each project concentrates on an independent component of the network, and the Company has implemented stringent controls to ensure the utmost confidentiality of the full capabilities of the satellite.

**Management's Assertion**

The Company's management asserts that the description of the Company's System is presented accurately, in all material respects, based on the description criteria. Management also asserts that the controls related to the applicable Trust Services Criteria were suitably designed to provide reasonable assurance that the applicable Trust Services Criteria would be met if the controls operated effectively as of the specified date.

**Service Auditor's Opinion**

In our professional opinion, the description of the Company's System is accurately presented, in all material respects, based on the description criteria. Furthermore, the controls related to the applicable Trust Services Criteria were suitably designed to provide reasonable assurance that the applicable Trust Services Criteria would be met if the controls operated effectively as of the specified date.

**Service Auditor's Responsibilities**

Our responsibility is to express an informed opinion on the fairness of the presentation of the Company's System based on our comprehensive examination. We conducted our examination in accordance with attestation standards established by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants. These standards necessitate that we plan and perform the examination to obtain reasonable assurance about whether, in all material respects, the description of the Company's System is accurately presented and the controls were suitably designed to meet the applicable Trust Services Criteria as of the specified date. We are confident that the evidence we obtained is sufficient and appropriate to provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.

**Restriction on Use**

This report is intended solely for the information and use of the Company, its customers, and prospective customers, and is not intended to be, and should not be, used by anyone other than these specified parties.

**Service Auditor**
